level.heading: AQUATIC ANIMAL PROTECTION AND FISHING INFRACTIONS (§ 16-3645)

level.text: Reserved
Violation of the following provision shall be a Class 2 infraction:
19 DCMR § 1503.1(a) (introducing a species of fish or other aquatic organism not indigenous to the District of Columbia into the waters of the District of Columbia).
Violation of the following provision shall be a Class 3 infraction:
19 DCMR § 1503.1(e) (capturing, harassing, harming or failing to return to the waters immediately any organism listed as a threatened or endangered species).
Violation of any of the following provisions shall be a Class 4 infraction:
19 DCMR § 1502.1 (taking of a fish or any other aquatic organism for sale or profit);
19 DCMR § 1503.1(b) (possession of a fish which is under the minimum legal size);
19 DCMR § 1503.1(c) (possessing more of a particular species of fish than is allowed by law);
19 DCMR § 1503.1(d) (possessing fish with prescribed weight, from which the heads and tails have been removed);
19 DCMR § 1503.1(f) (use of explosives, chemicals, firearms or electricity to take or injure fish or aquatic organisms);
19 DCMR § 1503.1(h) (taking fish illegally);
19 DCMR § 1503.1(i) (taking, catching or possessing striped bass or hybrid striped bass); or
19 DCMR § 1506.1 (angling for striped bass or hybrid striped bass).
Violation of any of the following provisions shall be a Class 5 infraction:
19 DCMR § 1501.1 (fishing without a license);
19 DCMR § 1501.3 (failure to display license upon request);
19 DCMR § 1501.4 (collecting fish for scientific purposes without a permit);
19 DCMR § 1501.5 (fishing without a valid license);
19 DCMR §§ 1501.2 through 1502.7 (fishing with unauthorized equipment or methods); or
19 DCMR § 1503.1(g) (taking, catching or possessing a sturgeon).
